newsitem.title: USA: System Software says it met Q4 objectives.
newsitem.headline: System Software says it met Q4 objectives.

text.p: System Software Associates Inc said it achieved its business objectives for the fourth quarter and had cash balances of $35 million at the end of the period, up from $19 million at the beginning.
"We believe we had the best-ever quarter in our North America operations as well as greatly improved international results," the company said.

Strong North American business reflected good market acceptance of the BPCS Client/Server Version 6.0, it said. "Over the next two months we expect at least 30 more clients to go live with full enterprise-wide systems," it said.
The company said it met every product shipment date on every platform and database planned during the quarter.

"Our worldwide pipeline of new business opportunities is far and away the largest in the history of the company. We enter our new fiscal year with strong momentum and great confidence," said Chief Executive Roger Covey.
The company has not yet issued its fourth-quarter results.
Shares in the business information systems concern were off 3/4 at 11.
